title: Britain's Got Talent final: Paddy and Nicko take on Dirty Dancing
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Britain’s Got Talent have served us all with a sneak peek of what’s to come in the Champion’s final, and boy does it look good.

After receiving the infamous golden buzzer from David Walliams, the ballroom dancers Paddy and Nicko have pulled out all the stops for their performance.

Despite being 85-years-old, the salsa star has decided to take on the iconic Dirty Dancing routine with her fellow professional.

Starting off their act, Nicko can be heard shouting: ‘No one puts Paddy in the corner.’

They then take centre stage and show off a number of twists, with the judges watching in anticipation for the iconic lift.

Paddy and Nicko take on the iconic Dirty Dancing routine (Picture: ITV)

No one puts Paddy in the corner (Picture: ITV)

However, we guess we’ll just have to wait and see if they manage to pull it off, as the preview cuts short mid-way through their act.

The tease.

Paddy and Nicko previously finished ninth when they entered Britain’s Got Talent back in 2014, but the pair were sent straight through to the final following their salsa routine.

After watching them dance away to a standing ovation just last month, David Walliams said: ‘There are very few acts you can watch with a smile on your face and tears in your eyes.

They were David Walliams’ golden buzzer act (Picture: Rex)

‘This is one of the most joyous, most beautiful, most life-affirming acts we’ve ever had on Britain’s Got Talent.

‘So let’s not mess about. Let’s do this for everybody here.’

David rushed around the desk to hit the golden buzzer, sparking a shower of confetti and a particularly grateful Paddy and Nicko.

Speaking about the buzzer, Paddy said: ‘Just incredible. David, thank you so much. David is a very special name to me, it was my husband’s name, thank you so much.’
